content.raw:
As I said before, this pull request reduces drift for Atlas's feet and the drc vehicle. In my testing with Atlas walking, driving the drc_vehicle, and grasping the firehose, it appears to improve physics performance and reduce velocity noise with no performance cost.

The evidence against is that it causes the SimplePendulum test to fail, though it fails in a section related to adjusting physics engine parameters ([see physics.cc:1421](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/18c3d8d77294/test/regression/physics.cc#cl-1421)). On the other hand, the SimplePendulum test involves a model with an ill-conditioned mass matrix, as well as simulation parameters that differ from those used in the VRC simulator.

The pluses outweigh the strange behavior of the SimplePendulum test for me.
